message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Development Indicators dataset and the Global Hunger Index, we analyze the relationship between poverty and hunger in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Global Hunger Index"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This research paper uses a combination of national and household level data from the India Human Development Survey to examine patterns in intergenerational educational mobility and its determinants.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we use satellite remote sensing data from NASA's Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS) to assess vegetation change in response to natural disasters across different regions in Asia.", "dataset": ["NASA's Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To explore the relationship between social programs and poverty reduction, we utilize two datasets: the Cash Transfer and Child Outcomes dataset and the Multi-Purpose Household Survey conducted in Mexico.", "dataset": ["Cash Transfer and Child Outcomes", "Multi-Purpose Household Survey"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This report examines patterns and trends in energy access and affordability using three complementary datasets: the Global Tracking Framework, the Energy Access Outlook Report, and the PASSION database.", "dataset": ["Global Tracking Framework", "Energy Access Outlook Report", "PASSION database"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Analyzing data from both the Demographic and Health Surveys and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys, we investigate inequalities in child malnutrition across different geographic and socio-economic groups in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We employ a panel of firm-level data from the World Bank's Enterprise Survey and spatial data on natural resource endowments to disentangle factors influencing firm productivity in the mining sector.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of administrative data from the Ministry of Labor and Social Security and household survey data from China Family Panel Studies, we examine dynamics and trends in employment and wage inequality in urban areas in China.", "dataset": ["Ministry of Labor and Social Security", "China Family Panel Studies"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on data from the World Values Survey and Eurobarometer to assess attitudes towards democracy and good governance in European Union member states.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Eurobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the impact of public transportation infrastructure on regional economic growth, we use a combination of publicly available street network data and proprietary transportation demand forecasting data from Transport for New South Wales.", "dataset": ["Transport for New South Wales"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}]
